definition: father or founder of a nation/Father of the Republic (Sun Yat-sen)

sentences.english: We celebrate Washington today as the greatest of the founding fathers.
sentences.chinese: 今日，我们尊称华盛顿为美国国父。

sentences.english: Chungshan Hall, National Dr. Sun Yat-sen Application Form for Group Visit.
sentences.chinese: 国立国父纪念馆阳明山中山楼管理所团体参观申请表。

sentences.english: Dr. Sun Yat-sen has become young, and he also wears glasses.
sentences.chinese: 国父孙中山先生变年轻了，而且他还带了一副眼镜。

definition: Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
democratic revolution/bourgeois revolution (in Marx-Leninist theory, a prelude to the proletarian revolution)
honorific title for Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石[Jiang3 Jie4 shi2]
Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People (late 1890s)
president (of a country)/same as 總統|总统
Aung San (1915-1947), Burmese general and politician, hero of Myanmar independence movement and father of Aung San Su Kyi 昂山素季[Ang2 Shan1 Su4 Ji4]
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations

democracy/civil liberties/principle of democracy, the second of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning widespread popular involvement in affairs of state)
